Which VM/version are you debugging your program on? Does it support JDI? The 
error message indicates that the library used for JDWP is missing.

I have jre 1.3.1 under eclipse directory
$ ./java -version
java version "1.3.1_01"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.3.1_01)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.3.1_01, mixed mode)

The machine has 1.2.2 in the path, but I do not suppose it is being used.
$ java -version
java version "1.2.2"
Solaris VM (build Solaris_JDK_1.2.2_05a, native threads, sunwjit)

Can you change the PATH to see if this has any effect? the 1.2.2 VM does not 
generally support JDI, and is suspicious.

Unsetting the path did not help.
It looks like the jre does not contain the file libjdwp.so.  I do not know if
it is supposed to have that file or not.

I started eclipse with -vm and pointed to the full jdk installation that 
contains the libjdwp.so file, that fixed the problem.

Yes, the jdwp.so is required, so you need to point to the full jdk installation.

Closing
